deskripsi_gejala.name: Tick Fever
deskripsi_gejala.description: Tick fever is a common illness in dogs and cats caused by tick-borne pathogens. Early signs may include fever (up to 105°F [40.5°C]), loss of appetite, enlargement of the lymph nodes, inflammation of several joints, coughing or difficulty in breathing, abdominal pain, vomiting and diarrhea, and swelling of the face or extremities.
deskripsi_gejala.treatment: Treatment involves removing ticks safely, isolating the pet, and providing comfort. Consult a veterinarian for appropriate medications and care.

deskripsi_gejala.name: Distemper
deskripsi_gejala.description: Distemper is a viral disease that affects dogs and, to a lesser extent, cats. Early signs may include fever (up to 105°F [40.5°C]), loss of appetite, enlargement of the lymph nodes, inflammation of several joints, coughing or difficulty in breathing, abdominal pain, vomiting and diarrhea, and swelling of the face or extremities.
deskripsi_gejala.treatment: Treatment focuses on supportive care, including fluids and medications to manage symptoms. Vaccination is crucial for prevention.

deskripsi_gejala.name: Parvovirus
deskripsi_gejala.description: Parvovirus is a highly contagious viral illness affecting dogs, especially puppies. Early signs may include fever (up to 105°F [40.5°C]), loss of appetite, enlargement of the lymph nodes, inflammation of several joints, coughing or difficulty in breathing, abdominal pain, vomiting and diarrhea, and swelling of the face or extremities.
deskripsi_gejala.treatment: Immediate veterinary attention is essential. Treatment involves supportive care, including fluids and medications to control vomiting and diarrhea.

deskripsi_gejala.name: Hepatitis
deskripsi_gejala.description: Hepatitis is a viral infection affecting the liver in dogs. Early signs may include fever (up to 105°F [40.5°C]), loss of appetite, enlargement of the lymph nodes, inflammation of several joints, coughing or difficulty in breathing, abdominal pain, vomiting and diarrhea, and swelling of the face or extremities.
deskripsi_gejala.treatment: Treatment involves supportive care, including medications to support liver function. Vaccination is crucial for prevention.

deskripsi_gejala.name: Tetanus
deskripsi_gejala.description: Tetanus is a bacterial infection that can affect dogs and cats. Early signs may include fever (up to 105°F [40.5°C]), loss of appetite, enlargement of the lymph nodes, inflammation of several joints, coughing or difficulty in breathing, abdominal pain, vomiting and diarrhea, and swelling of the face or extremities.
deskripsi_gejala.treatment: Treatment involves wound care, anti-tetanus medications, and supportive care. Vaccination is a preventive measure.

deskripsi_gejala.name: Chronic Kidney Disease
deskripsi_gejala.description: Chronic kidney disease is a common condition in older cats and dogs. Early signs may include increased thirst, weight loss, lethargy, and changes in urination.
deskripsi_gejala.treatment: Treatment focuses on managing symptoms, including a special diet, medications, and regular veterinary check-ups.

deskripsi_gejala.name: Diabetes
deskripsi_gejala.description: Diabetes can affect both dogs and cats. Early signs may include increased thirst, changes in appetite, weight loss, and changes in urination.
deskripsi_gejala.treatment: Treatment involves insulin therapy, dietary management, and regular monitoring of blood glucose levels.

deskripsi_gejala.name: Gastrointestinal Disease
deskripsi_gejala.description: Gastrointestinal diseases, such as gastroenteritis, can affect dogs and cats. Symptoms may include vomiting, diarrhea, abdominal pain, and changes in appetite.
deskripsi_gejala.treatment: Treatment involves dietary management, medications to control symptoms, and addressing the underlying cause.

deskripsi_gejala.name: Allergies
deskripsi_gejala.description: Allergies are common in both dogs and cats, causing skin and respiratory issues. Symptoms may include itching, redness, sneezing, and respiratory distress.
deskripsi_gejala.treatment: Treatment involves identifying and avoiding allergens, medications, and in some cases, immunotherapy.

deskripsi_gejala.name: Gingivitis
deskripsi_gejala.description: Gingivitis is an inflammation of the gums in dogs and cats. Symptoms may include redness, swelling, and bleeding of the gums.
deskripsi_gejala.treatment: Treatment involves dental care, including regular brushing, professional cleanings, and addressing underlying dental issues.

deskripsi_gejala.name: Cancers
deskripsi_gejala.description: Cancers can affect dogs and cats, with various types and symptoms. Early detection and diagnosis are crucial for effective treatment.
deskripsi_gejala.treatment: Treatment varies based on the type of cancer and may include surgery, chemotherapy, and supportive care.

deskripsi_gejala.name: Skin Rashes
deskripsi_gejala.description: Skin rashes can occur in dogs and cats due to various causes, including allergies, infections, or parasites. Symptoms may include redness, itching, and changes in skin texture.
deskripsi_gejala.treatment: Treatment involves identifying and addressing the underlying cause, along with medications to alleviate symptoms.
